website_summaries.verdict: The best laptop sound card to choose when you want better audio quality and control without having to open the box.
pros: Large size of the sound card's body makes it easy to control the volume
Audio quality rivals many internal sound card options
cons: Sounds can come out as muddied from automatic audio effects that need to be turned off

customer_reviews.title: Finally I can get rid of Realtek audio on Mini-Desktop Media Center PC
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with a ASUS VC62B-B014M Mini-Desktop computer. The ASUS has had problems with the Windows 10 Realtek audio drivers and I finally gave up. I downloaded and installed the newest Sound Blaster Windows 10 driver package for this unit and it has worked perfectly. Ended my audio problems completely, I now have 5.1 audio on all programs, from Plex Media Player to amazon.com video via Firefox and Chrome. Whole install took about 10 minutes and that included tweaking audio settings in my programs. Completely problem free installation and best $65.00 I have spent on audio for my Media Center computer ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: It works fine after playing with it a while.
customer_reviews.text: If you are used to wrestling with software and drivers just a little bit this device is great. Using it on Win10. I got it to get the fiber optic link. I now have two PCs - one on the main USB cable and the second on the AUX input - playing - via fiber optic cable (not included) - through my 20-year-old Pioneer surround sound amp with 5.1 speakers. Excellent! With the auxin port and the excellent "Entertainment Console" app I can mix background music from one PC along with spoken word instructional videos playing on the other. Exactly what I needed and put some old cables and my unused old amp and speakers back to work.
customer_reviews.author: Gains

customer_reviews.title: Makes thump and crack noise when USB ports are reset
customer_reviews.text: When booting Windows normally resets the USB ports, which briefly kills power to the USB ports. When the Sound Blaster loses USB power the speakers thump. When USB port power is restored the speakers crack. I have powered 2.1 speakers which never lose power so the thump/crack is definitely coming from the Sound Blaster. The thump/crack happens twice on every boot of Windows. I've had to subtract 2 stars for the startling noises it make on every boot. The Sound Blaster otherwise works well.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C

customer_reviews.title: Compact, easy to install and setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a gaming laptop setup as I got tired of the crappy 2.1 speakers or using headphones all the time. Driver install was easy, just had to disable the other Sound Blaster software present that came for the laptop originally. I have Logitech X-540 5.1 Speakers hooked up to this card and they sound fantastic. I didn't think I would get to use them again after my Desktop computer died, but voila! They are alive once more and bringing aural bliss to my ears!
customer_reviews.author: Fossil

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: my latest desktop computer came with a dedicated (can't be replaced) sound card that is shi....err lousy...this bypasses it completely and gives me complete control of my 5.1 sound...it comes with a nice remote control which is a bonus...it would work great for a laptop too...I did have to download drivers for Windows 10..but that process was pretty simple...I've always trusted Creative sound devices and cards in the past and they didn't fail me this time either...
customer_reviews.author: tambourinemonkey66

customer_reviews.title: Great quality of life improvements for my PC
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something inexpensive that would give me more ports and easier access to audio ports as well as a remote control for my PC audio and came across this. I have been using it for a few months and it works great. I use it for all my audio. I haven't noticed any major sound improvements vs not having the usb sound card but I find the quality of life changes/ease of use improvements of having the remote control, more ports, and the volume knob worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT... when you can get it to work. NOT WINDOWS 10 FRIENDLY!
customer_reviews.text: Installation for Windows 10 was like running an I.T. minefield of failure. The driver takes a while to install. The damn driver would install "successfully" and NOT see the device! Unplugging the device and then plugging it back in... would show up for 1-2 seconds and then poof gone. It did this to THREE different computers with windows 10 on them. I finally got it to work on the laptop it was intended for after many attempts and it stayed working for months. Just yesterday I was told a windows 10 update made the damn thing stop working again. That is it. I am fed up and getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: ViralMad

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfies my needs
customer_reviews.text: I finally upgraded my 10 year old PC. I was using onboard audio which supported Dolby Prologic II for surround upmixing on 2 channel content. I spent literally hours trying to find drivers that worked to enable similar functionality. I finally gave up and ordered this SB box and am happy. I like how I'm able to adjust the amount of surround that's applied. Games sound great and immersive, and my audio collection sounds like what I'm used to again.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Torkko

customer_reviews.title: Was okay for the first few years...
customer_reviews.text: Warranty's out so at least I got my money's worth. Now the device has an audible repetitive click out the speakers upon starting the PC it is plugged into. Re-installing the driver failed as Windows 10 would not recognize the device plugged into it. The only way to install the driver with Windows 10 is to plug it in and let Windows find it online. When I bought this sound card I was still using Windows 8.1 as Win 10 hadn't been yet released.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisCrystalize

customer_reviews.title: Creative has always made drivers that are two convoluted. ...
customer_reviews.text: Creative has always made drivers that are two convoluted. You have to go thru two many steps to adjust the settings to get the desired "pseudo surround" and adjustments are required for practically every track. If you turn the volume low, than the balance settings revert to 50, 50. Instead of 1 control panel, there are two, and each of them is subdivided into sub-panels for each function. The remote control only fully works with their player software, so if you have a player you prefer, forget using one or the other.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. You can find other USB DAC's for cheaper and get similar quality sound, but you buy this for the software bundle that Creative offers. It has EQ adjustments along with some other gimmicky but cool stuff. I like it for the "Smart Volume" feature that it has, which serves to boost the low volume sounds and tone down the high volume sounds. Works great for shooter games when you want to hear footsteps, but don't want to be deaf from the gun shots (PUBG).
customer_reviews.author: Randy Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Creative Lab's Astuteness
customer_reviews.text: I'm not new to Creative products and I used my Audigy 2SZ soundcard for years with my Logitech Z500's. The delivery was professional sounding. I bought the Creative Sound Blaster X-Fi Surround 5.1 Pro USB Audio System after realizing how much of my time was getting spent on a laptop. I ended up using a laptop at home for my entertainment too but it was unfair to expect the laptop to drive my big THX certified set of speakers. The X-Fi surround will live up to most audiophiles' expectations. This external soundcard is serious. I like the nifty and tiny remote control too.
customer_reviews.author: Nobby Mabale

customer_reviews.title: Constant noise and volume control did not work.
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I plugged it in, it made constant popping noises. I tried moving cables and reinserting to insure good connection, Creative drivers and software, etc. When it boots up it makes loud popping noises and then continues albeit more quietly. The volume control has never worked with either the remote or the knob on the unit. Built a new computer recently and had the same effect.
customer_reviews.author: RoadKing00

customer_reviews.title: Great sound at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: On my new build my graphics card takes up a huge amount of space so I had to go external for sound. This unit does not disappoint. I'm using my 20 year old Klipsch ProMedia 4.1 and they have never sounded so crisp and clean. The X-Fi has a number of DSP effects and an adequate selection of tools to customize your sound to match your room. Highly recommend for great sound at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Molly_Dog

customer_reviews.title: Don't Expect Surround Sound from Music Files
customer_reviews.text: If gaming, probably very good. For music, do not get much sound from rear speakers, very weak. Was told by technical customer service rep that it was normal not to get much sound from rear speakers when playing music. Had I known that, would not have purchased. Currently not using Blaster and have laptop set to stereo with better sound than with Blaster. Dilly-dilly!
customer_reviews.author: W. M. Newsome

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with Windows 10 pro & optical out to 5.1 receiver
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping to use this on my Windows 10 pro HTPC but I got nothing but popping/stuttering audio every few seconds using optical out to my 5.1 receiver. I made sure to use the latest drivers available on the creative web site and tried many different settings and no luck. Too bad it would've been perfect with the Dolby Digital Live feature it has.
customer_reviews.author: DaveC

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, unbeatable flexibility.
customer_reviews.text: As the owner of a previous model of this device, which I use on my older laptop, I had every expectation that this device would serve me just as well. I found it to be everything it claims to be. The sound is great, I have 4 speakers and a sub controlled by this device, the flexibility of use this device provides is priceless and it really makes my software games "pop". I recommend it to anyone wishing to improve the sound on their laptop as they play their music library or games. Of course, depending on what kind of sound card is installed on your PC tower, it can bring new life to your tower also.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: buggy windows 10 drivers
customer_reviews.text: 5.1 sound has been broken in windows 10 for some time. unsure if they will ever be fixed. nonethless, it is a good stereo unit that has been very valuable to me. i use a server board that does not have baked in sound. rather than using a valuable pcie slot, the usb option has been great. the ability to use it on other machines is also great. the volume knob is also a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: DGW 404

customer_reviews.title: This item is impossible to connect to your surround sound devices
customer_reviews.text: 1. I had a prior version of this and it worked without problem. this one will not connect to any of the 8 laptops we have in the house, and the one it does connect to only half the surround sound speakers work! WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: amiracali

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop Enhancement
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a high end gaming laptop for my everyday home computer. Laptops typically do not come with very advanced built in audio abilities. I wanted the ability to connect this laptop to my 5.1 Surround Sound Speakers and to have EAX effects. The Creative Sound Blaster X-Fi Surround 5.1 Pro USB Audio System easily extended my new Laptops audio abilities with a single connection to the laptop. When I take my laptop with me, a single cable disconnects the USB Audio Interface and the speakers system attached to it. The audio quality is exactly what I expect from Creative Labs, top quality!
customer_reviews.author: m.u

customer_reviews.title: Worked easily
customer_reviews.text: After a few attempts at some cheaper adapters that never seemed to quite work, I finally decided to go ahead and put a little more money and I couldn't be happier. Worked right out of box once I hooked it up and it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian James

customer_reviews.title: Sends a blast of static down the line when power cycled
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with Windows 10. When I restart my system the X-Fi blasts my speakers with a loud static pop. Would not recommend anyone ever purchase this or connect any speakers to it.
customer_reviews.author: msk

customer_reviews.title: It didn't give true surround sound like I expected this was my fault as I didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: It didn't give true surround sound like I expected this was my fault as I didn't know much about computers at the time eventually I bought an AVR and used my GPU's HDMI port to handle all of it the surround sound stuff. I gave this to a salvation army spot I couldn't bring myself to throw out hardware that was working. The most annoying thing was the insanely bright blue LED.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Very easy install
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my SFF Dell where there is not enough room for a 5.1 sound card. This external sounds just as good as an internal and priced right. Software is easy to manage.
customer_reviews.author: Okie_guy

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good unit at a pretty good price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sound card. Installation was a breeze. Plugged the sound card into a USB port (USB cable supplied), installed the software (straight forward, just a of clicks), plugged in my speakers and worked like a charm. Sound quality is definitely a step up from integrated audio on my PC. Very clear, full sound. Must be better digital audio converters. Comes with tons of software including the audio control panel which gives you tons of options to add special effects to the sound (and mic input). Has a 9-band equalizer if your willing to look for it! All told a pretty good unit at a pretty good price!
customer_reviews.author: Tezza

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this card
customer_reviews.text: Every 15 or seconds or so I get a pop or crackle. It is a universal problem with windows 10, multiple devices tried. Be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: It works when I disconnect the USB cable and plug it back in after 30 seconds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in December 2018 to replace the crap sound card that is integrated into the computer's motherboard and it did work... for a while and after playing audio, whether from games or videos, everything went south. The videos stutter or not play at all and would only work if the USB cable is reseated every time. The PCI-e version of the X-Fi my dad has works better than my USB audio card.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Brings quality music to a laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. He likes to listen to music and I had purchased a Logitech 5.1 system for his desktop years ago. As he grew older he moved on to a laptop and could not use the 5.1 to its fullest abilities. He had to use an adaptor that gave him 2.0 stereo through a 5.1 He really likes having high quality music again when listening to his music files or streaming. A plus that he has now is he can control the bass. Living in an apartment and listening to music without controlling the bass means you cant listen very loud.
customer_reviews.author: jkhughes

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy install, sounds great
customer_reviews.text: I was pulling my hair out. I have this high-end computer with an Asus Sabertooth MOBO, 7.1 onboard. Worked fine. Then I installed my 2nd ATI video card (2 7900 series cards) - no more audio. Wasted literally days tryinf to solve the audio problem. Nothing worked. I finally gave up and ordered this USB based audio solution. Plugged in - had audio instantly. Then I installed the drivers and software, let it do an update to the firmware, software and drivers. Rebooted. Still have sound. Glorious sound. If you're having a problem getting your onboard audio to work (AC 97 or HiDef) - skip wasting hours or days - just spend a few bucks and get this!
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Drew

customer_reviews.title: I am really happy with this sound card. No regrets at all!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little sound card! Drives my Logitech sound system like I've never heard it before! I like the fact that I can turn the effects on or off, change and shape the sound as I desire, and the best part is that it is portable, so I can take it anywhere, connect it to my laptop, plug-in to any speaker system, and jam. It has really fantastic sound--much netter than I expected for the price of the unit. I am really happy with this sound card!
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Glaum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for otherwise obsolete Dell speakers
customer_reviews.text: Turned my Dell 5.1 speakers into great speakers for my HP laptop. Easy to set up. Dial on top used for volume control and mutes when pressed. USB cable that came with it is long enough to have the Blaster away from my work space. Can't get headphones to work when plugged into the device but that's not why I bought it. Also, can't figure out how to get the remote working, but I didn't even know it was going to have a remote. No big deal to me.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas P. Lozowy

customer_reviews.title: Laptop and switch capability
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my fiances laptop since our sound system only uses a optical cable. We also tried this on our SWITCH which only has USB and hdmi cable inputs and it works without any setup. Definitely worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: michelleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great external card.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good sound card which would make it easier to adjust the volume without messing in the volume control panel. the software has a pop up where you can see the volume level when you adjust it useing the physical knob on the card. The audio is clear and the usb connection is nice. I bought refirbished and have had no problems. i cannot say anything about the 5.1 part because my primary listening device is a pair of senheizer hd519's and they sound great hooked up to this.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C.

customer_reviews.title: It works well. The only problems I have are ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well. The only problems I have are that I need to unplug it and plug it back in when I boot windows to get it working and that it picks up some interference from my monitor which was resolved by putting. Static bag above it.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Smith

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Did everything a DAC couldn't. This external sound card produced 5.1 from my USB on my laptop. Bypassing your onboarding sound via laptop is always a good idea. If 7.1 was needed Creative offers similar external cards that would have worked with some extra $ invested.
customer_reviews.author: chris putnam

customer_reviews.title: Recording with the X-Fi Surround 5.1 Pro USB System
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Creative Soundblaster X-Fi Surround 5.1 Pro USB Audio System with THX SB1095 with the expectation of being able to "plug & record"; however, I found that in order to record, a separate program (Creative Media Toolbox 6 - $39.99) had to be ordered (It came with a 30 day trial). Also, in order to record or convert to MP3 format, another program had to be ordered (MP3 audio pack - $9.99). Other than Creative getting greedy, this is a great sound card. Sterling N. Davis
customer_reviews.author: Sterling N. Davis

customer_reviews.title: and he is very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: The item was shipped quickly... It was as advertised... Seller promptly asnwered all my questions... But For some reasons, this Sound Blaster wasn't working properly on my system... So I gave it to a friend, and he is very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: A. Mandelli

customer_reviews.title: 5.1 SPDIF Audio on Win10 Laptop? Yup!
customer_reviews.text: I have an awesome receiver, but I got it just before HDMI was put on everything. Passing audio from the TV to the receiver just gave me stereo over HDMI (that's a hardware issue it seems). I have 7.1 and I'm playing in stereo... that just won't do. Hooked up this bad boy with a fiber cable and bam, 5.1/7.1 games and movies. Where did that shot come from? Behind me! Sweet. Being USB-powered, there's only 1 cable to deal with when connecting/disconnecting it. It's light enough that you can easily attach it to a laptop with some velcro/hook-n-loop tape. Grab the latest drivers from their site; the ones on the CD are out of date.
customer_reviews.author: Stippy

customer_reviews.title: Great addition!
customer_reviews.text: We are one of the growing many who have cut our cable/satellite cord and now watch our media via the internet. To accomplish this we bought an inexpensive media computer with HDR capability and a HDMI output. Little did I know that even with a HDMI output, the computer does not port Dolby or other sound capabilities other than stereo, through the HDMI; and I loss the 5.1 capability that I so much love. This little unit fixed that and I now get great sound out of my 5.1 system.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant W

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could get 5.1 surround sound through optical out with my laptop. After having no luck with some cheaper USB sound cards on amazon I decided to try this one. Unlike the others this one works great on Windows 10. You just have to make sure the applications you use support surround sound and are configured correctly. For example, you can't get 5.1 surround sound on Netflix from a web browser but the Netflix app from the Windows store does support it.
customer_reviews.author: Guicho

customer_reviews.title: It's great for optical out and Dolby digital live surround sound
customer_reviews.text: I like that it allows Dolby digital live even with the terrible train wreck windows10 created with the sound cards and DDL windows still hasn't fixed their OS but creative has found a workaround. Just email sound blaster support and they will help. It's really easy to activate it. I did it on my own even before they emailed me back.
customer_reviews.author: Yader

customer_reviews.title: They did it again with an affordable product that has great sound and versatility
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this on my computer today. What can I say about creative labs? They did it again with an affordable product that has great sound and versatility. Love the way you can adjust the speaker volumes as well as the sound coming out of them. The equalizer is terrific and power dvd is super! Thank you creative labs!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aloysius A. Korenkiewicz Jr.

customer_reviews.title: USB Soundcard Perfect for Me
customer_reviews.text: My computer had no more free expansion slots, so this USB sound card was perfect for me, because I wanted to install a 5.1 speaker system. There was no way to do that with the internal PC sound card. There were absolutely no installation problems (PC with Windows 7--32 Bit). The unit fits nicely under my monitor, along with the remote control, giving me easy access to the headset and microphone jack. Anything else I might say has already been said by other reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: Sengold

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect sound card for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried replacing my old SB X-Fi with many other sound cards, none worked as I wanted them too. This SB X-Fi Pro is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Grimnir

customer_reviews.title: Soublaster quality at its finest.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound blaster unit that is plug-and-play. Sound quality is excellent compatibility is excellent no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: TalbotWorks

customer_reviews.title: good once it works right
customer_reviews.text: for whatever reason, when I used this equipment, I got terrible crackling and popping form my speakers and headphones. I was going to return it, but didnt have time before I went on vacation. After coming home from vacation, I turned on my computer and suddenly it worked perfectly fine... a week of troubleshooting and messing with settings and all it took was for it to sit there for a week more before it worked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Pink

customer_reviews.title: Sweeeeeeeeet USB DAC
customer_reviews.text: BOOM! This USB DAC is the bee's knees! Besides having fantastic sound output the line-in is processed and noise is reduced. The software is on the "meh" side so I can't comment on it much. The design is rather sleek and it's nice to look at. This puppy will destroy any onboard sound and I highly recommend it. It would have been nice to have two outputs so that I can have headphones and speakers attached but it's not that big of deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device. I have it connected to my laptop dock and it sends surround signal to my 5.1 MAudio speakers. I haven't tried any of the inputs or the DSP yet, but as a playback device it sounds great and has TONS of gain. Also I love the fact it comes with a remote. I may update this review as I use the device more, but so far it gets a 5 star rating from me. It's exactly what I expected and what I needed to connect my laptop to my 5.1 speaker system.
customer_reviews.author: blast7

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but could be louder.
customer_reviews.text: It does its job, sound is clear but may leave you yearning for something a little louder. Even passed through an amplifier I still felt like I was missing something. Used this in my Car PC for a while before I had to upgrade to a real sound card for clarity and volume. Also, it will eat up CPU power so make sure your board can handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Electronics: sound blaster module
customer_reviews.text: I will use the item for signal conversion in a ham radio assembly involving Software Defined Radio
customer_reviews.author: NoVA guy

customer_reviews.title: Transforms your PC into a sound machine
customer_reviews.text: Good external usb sound card. Sounds great via optical output. to my Logitech Z623's. Came without a remote though, hence 4 stars. BTW, creative's customer service is the absolute Pitts!!
customer_reviews.author: J Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Connects and works well. I use it as a ...
customer_reviews.text: Connects and works well. I use it as a USB to TOSLINK converter going to a Logitec Z5500 system for 5.1 and also as a headphone amp. Price is high for the quality of the unit. There are all kinds of random noise artifacts that somehow make it to the headphone output. Also, the unit creaks and cracks after turning it on; seemingly from internal components warming up. All kinds of strange noises.I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Metz

customer_reviews.title: Fixed the interference
customer_reviews.text: This solved the rediculous amount of static, pops, and random interference inside my desktop PC that had mutiple soundcards sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Kev Car

customer_reviews.title: X-Fi 5.1 Pro USB
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is good for the money. But I also believe that in the process of the digital age somethings have been totally lost in translation. Sound quality doesnot compare to the analog output of my old ZS card that I can no longer use. This is a disappoint in one particular way.Sound adjustment by EQ. I use my computer for surround for my TV and to no avail no output for surround, analog out only produces 2.1 not 5.1. When the ZS card processed all sound from any source 5.1 .
customer_reviews.author: rory mcdaris

customer_reviews.title: The main reason I bought this product was to make sound measurements and I'm really disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The product has a frequency response limited to 16kHz and when testing individual channels there are "leaks" to other channels, in other words: when testing front channel, the test sound can be faintly heard over the surround speakers. The main reason I bought this product was to make sound measurements and I'm really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: hnmc

customer_reviews.title: no problems
customer_reviews.text: i purchased the external USB sound card because I was getting an electric humming sound with speakers and headphones with my internal card. My on board sound and pci-express 7.1 card both produced the humming/buzzing sound. It was my first time purchasing an external sound device. most products give you a cheap USB cable. not this one. you get a nice long cable. software installs easy. windows 7 loads the drivers without issues. software runs great. no issues.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I needed an increase in the quality and volume of my PC's sound. Primarily because of the great reviews, I selected this product. As far as the quality of the sound, I observed no improvement. As to the volume, after installation, it was not as loud. Actually, the volume control on the device didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Good price and is a great external sound card
customer_reviews.text: This was for a business item that called for audio streaming and met the need.
customer_reviews.author: R Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Annoying driver install, generally okay
customer_reviews.text: Physical volume control doesn't work without the driver on Windows 7. I don't have a problem with that, but the installer is pretty annoying - my only option is to install a bunch of other software along with the relevant drivers. This is quite annoying. Also, without the driver, Skype for Business 2016 does not recognize any microphone or line-in on the device. This will probably be fine once the driver finishes installing, but the process is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Dave See

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an external sound card for my Astro a40's. I am currently using a laptop and I do not an optical port on my laptop, so I needed a External sound card that did. This work PERFECTLY with the Astro a40's. Gives you amazing 5.1 surrond on my laptop. Has a volume dial and a remote to control it from far away. I recently hooked up my laptop to my surround sound with this card and I could not be happier with it. Very easy to install and I highly recommend it to anyone who needs an external sound card with Dolby digital live.
customer_reviews.author: Vivolus

customer_reviews.title: it was great to get this 5
customer_reviews.text: I use an old laptop that has a broken screen as a media center. Since the screen is broken, I just have it permanently attached to my front room television. As a media center, watching netflix and what not, it was great to get this 5.1 system for the laptop. It works perfectly just as advertised. My subwoofer isn't working with it but I'm starting to think it's a problem with my stereo, not this product.
customer_reviews.author: GK Chase

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device
customer_reviews.text: this device is just awesome a must buy for laptops if you want to hook up to your 5.1 analog headphones or speakers. The integrated soundcard on laptop is crippled for the aforementioned purposes..that is where this device comes in handy and you can observe a real bump in sound quality. just connect the USB and download latest drivers from Creative website (Recommended). I would definitely recommend this product. You cant go wrong when you buy from AMaz(ing)on.
customer_reviews.author: Nishikant

customer_reviews.title: Going to return
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item so I could hook my computer up to my 5.1 surround system via the optical port on the device. The device says it supports 5.1 but it does not, in fact it produces a quality of sound that is not only aweful, but down right un usable. The stereo outs work great, but unfortunately that is not why I bought this product. In summary: do not buy to use with 5.1 surround via an optical connection.
customer_reviews.author: John William

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for isolating machine noise
customer_reviews.text: I had tried dozens of combinations to isolate machine noise (likely from the video card) from my front audio inputs (I use a set of Shure headphones, and the noise is rather distracting). This unit is the solution the finally worked, and it provides exceptional, noise-free sound. My only irks: There is no quick way to switch between headphone and speaker sound without unplugging your headphones, and the remote doesn't appear to be working anymore.
customer_reviews.author: sirnumbskull

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Convenient size. Awesome price point.
customer_reviews.text: Control panel is easy to use. The sound coming out of this guy is pretty great too. Better than most on-board sound card options. If you have a 5.1 headset (that has multiple 3.5mm jacks) this will work great for you. Volume knob is pretty darn convenient as well.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Thatcher

customer_reviews.title: Great Device in a Linux Install for HTPC using old HP 8000 USDT
customer_reviews.text: I use it on an old computer I use as an HTPC with a Display Port and no HDMI. So I used this to get digital audio out on a fiber to my Home Theater system. Great price also. Linux picked it right up. Well Linux always works great for me whatever I try.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M Taffuri

customer_reviews.title: Replaced older Creative
customer_reviews.text: I am a Mobile DJ and an external sound card is worth the price. Sound is better than my onboard soundcard and makes it easier to use. This one replaced an older Creative sound card I had and loved. It still works great but I sold it to a friend with my older laptop for them to use. This has better input/output plugs and did a little more. Also previous one was white, I prefer the black. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: M. Berely

customer_reviews.title: This item works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This item works like a charm. I use it for a laptop and have the Creative Gigaworks g500 (5.1) speaker setup with it. Being that the sound card and speakers are from the same company (Creative) they work seamlessly together and produce a VERY rich sound! Creative has been the only name I'm accustomed to for PC audio for the last 16 years and their products haven't let me down. Installation is easy and it takes a little bit of time to get the configuration adjusted to your personal liking with the audio module software, but once you nail it, you'll be immersed in your music/entertainment like you never were before.
customer_reviews.author: J-Dubb

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Easy install. Great price. I have a VERY GOOD set of 5.1 Logitech speakers and people say that the sound quality coming from my laptop is better than their home stereo. They can't believe that kind of sound can come from a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good card!
customer_reviews.text: It definitely sounds a LOT better than my Lenovo Thinkpad E430's onboard sound card. Currently I'm using Logitech Z603 2.1 speakers with it. Soon planning to get Logitech Z906 5.1.. Sound quality is pretty good if not excellent. Also I got defective remote control, which I'm gonna get replaced from Creative soon. Build Quality is Okay. It has enough I/Os. I'm not satisfied enough to give it 5 stars. But it is definitely good enough for 4 stars!

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and works well
customer_reviews.text: This unit works as advertised and am pleased with it's function and purpose. The USB cable it comes with is a good length - almost too long for what you need. I have had no issue with it and been using it for over a year. The inputs and provided cables cover most everything you would need. It is a Sound Blaster and that pretty much speaks for itself.

Impossible to make it work. I have experience in the software and the hardware used (speakers and cables) is the same as my desktop but I only got a lousy stereo sound with drop and cuts. I'm very disappointed by the product :( I tried different setup and drivers (when I could install them) but nothing.

customer_reviews.title: Product installation was simple and straightforward.
customer_reviews.text: I was very dissatisfied with the sound card installed on by Motherboard and so I decided to try this unit. Within minutes I was enjoying terrific sound from my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kelly

customer_reviews.title: 1 computer which is nice, but I couldn't do any channel testing on ...
customer_reviews.text: It works out of the box plugged into a windows 8.1 computer which is nice, but I couldn't do any channel testing on the individual speakers as if they were plugged into an internal card. It came with a driver/app disc, but I have no cd slot, so I attempted to download the software from Creative's site. Creative must be on a 56k connection because it took almost 2 hours to download a couple hundred megabytes. That was painful, and then when I installed the drivers the usb audio card kept connecting and disconnecting quickly. It was unusable until I uninstalled the drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Salem

customer_reviews.title: Great but susceptible to interference
customer_reviews.text: Really good but susceptible to interference. If you hear a light crackling / static noise, try elevating it. For example, I zip-tied mine to the back of my display mount and now I get no interference at all. Using a powered USB hub helps too.
customer_reviews.author: voidpointer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality sound box!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using SoundBlaster cards and products since they were first released. I now have a new Alienware 18x, fully loaded and the sound on it is great. But, I bought this too, to get the high-speed USB 3.0 and the Remote Control along with all the software. And, my music and videos sound great--- you can even shut the PC down with the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Rando

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I got mine 1 day ago. After 10 minutes the difference in audio quality is apparent. I only give 4 stars because I do not know how long this product will last or how it would sound with a better headset. So far, I like this product and hope it is built as well as first impressions would imply.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hayes

customer_reviews.title: It just worked
customer_reviews.text: My Windows 8 machine was rejecting the internal sound card after my upgrade. All sound was mono. I plugged this in and boom. I had 5.1 again. Also, I had 5.1 for the first time ever in Ubuntu Linux! It also actually sounds better than my built in sound ever did.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for Sound
customer_reviews.text: This product will improve the sound from your laptop or desktop. I was amazed by how much better my laptop sounded just by adding two external speakers to this sound card. The Sound Blaster added a deep bass and excellent highs. I can't wait to add more speakers and get the full benefit of this device.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I'm the guy who doesn't write reviews. Well, I needed to do some recording and mixing. The audio I captured was perfect, but on my computer the sound was horrible. So I surmised that it was just a crappy sound card. I bought Sound Blaster SBX and held my breath hoping it would do the trick. And it did. The sound through the SBX is top quality. I never realized just how bad the sound card was in my laptop. Sound recordings from YouTube and other sources just sparkle. Easy to install (about 10min) and I was up and running. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Julia Wright

customer_reviews.title: It made a world of difference and I was very pleasantly surprised after messing with the Creative software to get things set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cheap alternative to work with my Astro A40's and the Mix Amp since this USB sound card supports Dolby Digital Live. It made a world of difference and I was very pleasantly surprised after messing with the Creative software to get things set up the way I liked it. It isn't every day that you feel like you get your money's worth when it comes to buying a product but this exceeded my expectations and will suffice until I get the time to install a sound card in my pc.
customer_reviews.author: Benbinbeen

customer_reviews.title: Great adapter!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get the audio quality boost I was expecting, but it does drive my M6's better than the built in port in my laptop. On top of that, it provided an easy way to use my 5.1 speakers as they were intended while gaming. Remote is a very useful addition as well. Software is pretty easy to use and I'd set up a handful of different EQ types.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: The product is good when it works
customer_reviews.text: I had positive experience with this product and ordered a second one; the volume button in the second one stopped working after three months; at this point I cannot replace/return it through Amazon (too late), and there is a mess in the Amazon's references to the sellers ( in different places Amazon shows them coming from different sellers or the same seller). Besides, Amazon's "replace/return functionality" and "help" does not work: after several clicks I am getting to the same place where I started.
customer_reviews.author: YY

customer_reviews.title: Poor audio quality
customer_reviews.text: every time my computer reboots or comes out of sleep, it sends a a giant POP to the speakers (FAR louder than what the volume is set to). This week, after 5 months of usage, an inconsistent but very noticeable buzz has started.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: USB external sound card
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new Windows 7 PC. Wanted to have a AMD/ATI Crossfire set-up. Once you do this this particular ASUS Motherboard automatically disables the Motherboard sound outputs. I did not know this untill after the CrossFireX (2 HD6870's) were installed. There was no space on the Motherboard for an internal sound card. This USB external sound card was was the perfect answer. Easy to install and really good sound. By the way, never buy a CyberPower PC. For me, nothing but problems.

I personally use it to drive sound in a Logitech Z906 in digital sound and it works perfectly, just do not forget to activate Dolby Live sound. But, I would not recommend it to gamers, audiophiles and everyone that uses headphones as their main source of sound. But, for anyone out there with no dedicated audio that is trying to setting up a computer for the living room or any TV set this is a must.
